metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: XML Web Services
Web services are web application components.
content.html: Web services are web application components.

content.text: Web services can be published, found, and used on the Web.
content.html: Web services can be published, found, and used on the Web.

content.text: This tutorial introduces WSDL, SOAP, RDF, and RSS.
content.html: This tutorial introduces WSDL, SOAP, RDF, and RSS.

content.text: WSDL
SOAP
RDF
RSS
What You Should Already Know
Before you study web services you should have a basic understanding of XML and XML Namespaces.
content.html: Before you study web services you should have a basic understanding of XML and XML Namespaces.

content.text: If you want to study these subjects first, please read our XML Tutorial .
content.html: If you want to study these subjects first, please read our XML Tutorial.

content.text: Web Services
Interoperability has Highest Priority
When all major platforms could access the Web using Web browsers, different platforms couldn't interact. For these platforms to work together, Web-applications were developed.
content.html: When all major platforms could access the Web using Web browsers, different platforms couldn't interact. For these platforms to work together, Web-applications were developed.

content.text: Web-applications are simply applications that run on the web. These are built around the Web browser standards and can be used by any browser on any platform.
content.html: Web-applications are simply applications that run on the web. These are built around the Web browser standards and can be used by any browser on any platform.

content.text: Web Services take Web-applications to the Next Level
By using Web services, your application can publish its function or message to the rest of the world.
content.html: By using Web services, your application can publish its function or message to the rest of the world.

content.text: Web services use XML to code and to decode data, and SOAP to transport it (using open protocols).
content.html: Web services use XML to code and to decode data, and SOAP to transport it (using open protocols).

content.text: With Web services, your accounting department's Win 2k server's billing system can connect with your IT supplier's UNIX server.
content.html: With Web services, your accounting department's Win 2k server's billing system can connect with your IT supplier's UNIX server.

content.text: Web Services have Two Types of Uses
Reusable application-components.
content.html: Reusable application-components.

content.text: There are things applications need very often. So why make these over and over again?
content.html: There are things applications need very often. So why make these over and over again?

content.text: Web services can offer application-components like: currency conversion, weather reports, or even language translation as services.
content.html: Web services can offer application-components like: currency conversion, weather reports, or even language translation as services.

content.text: Connect existing software.
content.html: Connect existing software.

content.text: Web services can help to solve the interoperability problem by giving different applications a way to link their data.
content.html: Web services can help to solve the interoperability problem by giving different applications a way to link their data.

content.text: With Web services you can exchange data between different applications and different platforms.
content.html: With Web services you can exchange data between different applications and different platforms.

content.text: Any application can have a Web Service component.
content.html: Any application can have a Web Service component.

content.text: Web Services can be created regardless of programming language.
content.html: Web Services can be created regardless of programming language.

content.text: A Web Service Example
In the following example we will use ASP.NET to create a simple Web Service that converts the temperature from Fahrenheit to Celsius, and vice versa:
content.html: In the following example we will use ASP.NET to create a simple Web Service that converts the temperature from Fahrenheit to Celsius, and vice versa:

content.code:
<%@ WebService Language="VBScript" Class="TempConvert" %>


Imports System

Imports System.Web.Services


Public Class TempConvert :Inherits WebService


<WebMethod()> Public Function FahrenheitToCelsius(ByVal Fahrenheit As String) As String


dim fahr


fahr=trim(replace(Fahrenheit,",","."))


if fahr="" or IsNumeric(fahr)=false then return "Error"


return ((((fahr) - 32) / 9) * 5)

end function


<WebMethod()> Public Function CelsiusToFahrenheit(ByVal Celsius As String) As String


dim cel


cel=trim(replace(Celsius,",","."))


if cel="" or IsNumeric(cel)=false then return "Error"


return ((((cel) * 9) / 5) + 32)

end function


end class
content.code_html:
<%@ WebService Language="VBScript" Class="TempConvert" %>

Imports System
Imports System.Web.Services

Public Class TempConvert :Inherits WebService

<WebMethod()> Public Function FahrenheitToCelsius(ByVal Fahrenheit As String) As String
  dim fahr
  fahr=trim(replace(Fahrenheit,",","."))
  if fahr="" or IsNumeric(fahr)=false then return "Error"
  return ((((fahr) - 32) / 9) * 5)
end function

<WebMethod()> Public Function CelsiusToFahrenheit(ByVal Celsius As String) As String
  dim cel
  cel=trim(replace(Celsius,",","."))
  if cel="" or IsNumeric(cel)=false then return "Error"
  return ((((cel) * 9) / 5) + 32)
end function

end class

content.text: This document is saved as an .asmx file. This is the ASP.NET file extension for XML Web Services.
content.html: This document is saved as an .asmx file. This is the ASP.NET file extension for XML Web Services.

content.text: Example Explained
Note: To run this example, you will need a .NET server.
content.html: Note: To run this example, you will need a .NET server.

content.text: The first line in the example states that this is a Web Service, written in VBScript, and has the class name "TempConvert":
content.html: The first line in the example states that this is a Web Service, written in VBScript, and has the class name "TempConvert":

content.text: The next lines import the namespace "System.Web.Services" from the .NET framework:
content.html: The next lines import the namespace "System.Web.Services" from the .NET framework:

content.code_html:
Imports System
Imports System.Web.Services

content.text: The next line defines that the "TempConvert" class is a WebService class type:
content.html: The next line defines that the "TempConvert" class is a WebService class type:

content.code_html: Public Class TempConvert :Inherits WebService

content.text: The next steps are basic VB programming. This application has two functions. One to convert from Fahrenheit to Celsius, and one to convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
content.html: The next steps are basic VB programming. This application has two functions. One to convert from Fahrenheit to Celsius, and one to convert from Celsius to Fahrenheit.

content.text: The only difference from a normal application is that this function is defined as a "WebMethod()".
content.html: The only difference from a normal application is that this function is defined as a "WebMethod()".

content.text: Use "WebMethod()" to convert the functions in your application into web services:
content.html: Use "WebMethod()" to convert the functions in your application into web services:

content.code:
<WebMethod()> Public Function FahrenheitToCelsius(ByVal Fahrenheit As String) As String


dim fahr


fahr=trim(replace(Fahrenheit,",","."))


if fahr="" or IsNumeric(fahr)=false then return "Error"


return ((((fahr) - 32) / 9) * 5)

end function


<WebMethod()> Public Function CelsiusToFahrenheit(ByVal Celsius As String) As String


dim cel


cel=trim(replace(Celsius,",","."))


if cel="" or IsNumeric(cel)=false then return "Error"


return ((((cel) * 9) / 5) + 32)

end function
content.code_html:
<WebMethod()> Public Function FahrenheitToCelsius(ByVal Fahrenheit As String) As String
  dim fahr
  fahr=trim(replace(Fahrenheit,",","."))
  if fahr="" or IsNumeric(fahr)=false then return "Error"
  return ((((fahr) - 32) / 9) * 5)
end function

<WebMethod()> Public Function CelsiusToFahrenheit(ByVal Celsius As String) As String
  dim cel
  cel=trim(replace(Celsius,",","."))
  if cel="" or IsNumeric(cel)=false then return "Error"
  return ((((cel) * 9) / 5) + 32)
end function

content.text: Then, end the class:
content.html: Then, end the class:

content.text: Publish the .asmx file on a server with .NET support, and you will have your first working Web Service.
content.html: Publish the .asmx file on a server with .NET support, and you will have your first working Web Service.

content.text: Put the Web Service on Your Web Site
Using a form and the HTTP POST method, you can put the web service on your site, like this:
content.html: Using a form and the HTTP POST method, you can put the web service on your site, like this:

content.text: How To Do It
Here is the code to add the Web Service to a web page:
content.html: Here is the code to add the Web Service to a web page:

content.code:
Fahrenheit to Celsius:
Celsius to Fahrenheit:
content.code_html:
<form action='tempconvert.asmx/FahrenheitToCelsius'
method="post" target="_blank">
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>Fahrenheit to Celsius:</td>
    <td>
    <input class="frmInput" type="text" size="30" name="Fahrenheit">
    </td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td></td>
    <td align="right">
     <input type="submit" value="Submit" class="button">
     </td>
  </tr>
</table>
</form>

<form action='tempconvert.asmx/CelsiusToFahrenheit'
method="post" target="_blank">
<table>
  <tr>
    <td>Celsius to Fahrenheit:</td>
    <td>
    <input class="frmInput" type="text" size="30" name="Celsius">
    </td>
  </tr>
  <tr>
    <td></td>
    <td align="right">
    <input type="submit" value="Submit" class="button">
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
</form>

content.text: Substitute the "tempconvert.asmx" with the address of your web service like:
content.html: Substitute the "tempconvert.asmx" with the address of your web service like:

content.text: http://www.example.com/xml/tempconvert.asmx
content.html: http://www.example.com/xml/tempconvert.asmx
